faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: Introductory microeconomics.  How individuals and firms behave, and why we need a government.
description.et: Mikroökonoomika kesktaseme kursus. Sisuks on majandussubjektide käitumise modelleerimine, turutasakaalu tekkimisvõimaluste uurimine ja heaoluökonoomika.

objectives.en: The objective of the course is to introduce the students to the main concepts and results of microeconomics, and the way how economists think.The course provides an in depth coverage of Microeconomics and is focused on Consumer Demand, Producer Behavior, Market Structure and Strategic Behavior, and General Equilibrium.
objectives.et: Tutvustada mikroökonoomikat kui ühte võimalikku teoreetilist majandusmudelit.

description.et: The final grade of the course is formed as the sum of the results of three tests.

grade_preconditions.et:
A final mark is a sum of three tests and there is no other specific criteria for taking exam.

Test will mainly include exercises that are similar to those in the home assignments and classroom practical exercises.

grade_evaluation.et: Three tests (classroom test), each is one third of final mark.

debt_elimination.et:
Tests cannot be retaken.
If the score for the tests falls below the 51%, a re-exam must be taken during the exam session.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
Introduction to microeconomics
Course materials and requirements

Factors of Production
Production Possibility Curve

Demand and Supply
Determination of Equilibrium Price and Quantity

Applications of Demand and Supply
Government Intervention in Market Prices

Elasticity: A Measure of Response
The Price Elasticity of Demand and Supply

Markets, Maximizers, and Efficiency
The Logic of Maximizing Behavior

Consumer Theory
Utility Maximization and Demand

Competitive Markets for Goods and Services
Perfect Competition

Imperfect Competition
Monopoly, Efficiency, Equity, and Concentration of Power
Monopolistic Competition, Oligopoly
